title: Marketing website for IT consulting firm (virtualization + on‑prem IA for government contracts)

requirements.summary: Build a responsive, English-only marketing site that clearly positions the firm around virtualization and on‑prem infrastructure/IA for government contracts.
acceptanceCriteria: Site renders correctly on mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints
Clear positioning statement references virtualization and on‑prem infrastructure/IA for government contracts
All user-facing text is in English

file_operations.description: Create the primary app composition for the marketing website, including responsive layout scaffolding and top-level rendering of the required sections/pages content in English.
Implement the public marketing experience container that assembles the Home hero, Services, Capabilities, About, and Contact sections into a responsive flow.
Create a reusable responsive layout wrapper (header/main/footer) to keep spacing and typography consistent across the marketing site.

requirements.summary: Implement the core pages/sections (Home, Services, Capabilities, About, Contact) with clear navigation via scroll or route.
acceptanceCriteria: Top navigation links scroll or route to each major section/page
Each section contains concise, professional copy and headings relevant to virtualization, on‑prem infrastructure, and IA for government work
Layout remains readable and usable without horizontal scrolling at common viewport widths

file_operations.description: Create the top navigation/header with links that scroll to (or route to) Home, Services, Capabilities, About, and Contact sections; include responsive mobile navigation. If using shadcn-ui primitives (e.g., NavigationMenu/Sheet), verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Home hero section with a strong value proposition explicitly mentioning virtualization and on‑prem infrastructure/IA for government contracts; ensure responsive layout and readable typography.

Create a Services section with concise, professional service cards relevant to virtualization and on‑prem infrastructure delivery for government environments. If using shadcn-ui Card components, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a Capabilities section focused on government contracting/IA concerns (e.g., ATO support, compliance-minded hardening, documentation, ops handoff) with scannable headings and bullets.
Create an About section with professional firm narrative, mission, and differentiators tailored to high-trust government-facing work.
Create a Contact section that contains the contact form component and supporting copy (response expectations, what to include).
Wire newly created sections into the public marketing container with stable anchor IDs for navigation/scroll targets.
Ensure the app wires the marketing site view as the default public view and connects navigation behavior (anchor scrolling and/or hash routing) so sections are reachable from the header links.

requirements.summary: Add a validated Contact form that submits inquiries to the backend and shows success/error states.
acceptanceCriteria: Form validates required fields and email format before submit
On successful submit, user sees a confirmation state and the form resets
On failure, user sees an error message and can retry

file_operations.description: Implement the contact form UI (name, organization, email, message) with client-side validation, submit handling via the actor's submitContactInquiry capability, and clear success/error states. If using shadcn-ui Form/Input/Textarea/Button components, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a React Query mutation hook that calls the backend submitContactInquiry function through useActor, and normalizes success/error states for the ContactForm.
Wire the ContactForm into the Contact section and ensure the section provides the required fields and clear submission feedback messaging.

requirements.summary: Create an admin-only UI for signed-in admins to review submitted contact inquiries (list + detail).
acceptanceCriteria: Admin view requires Internet Identity sign-in
Non-admin users cannot access inquiry listings in the UI
Admin can view a list of inquiries and open an inquiry to see full details

file_operations.description: Create a Login/Logout button that uses the existing useInternetIdentity hook and clears React Query cache on logout (per selected authorization component guidance). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a lightweight first-login profile setup dialog that uses getCallerUserProfile/saveCallerUserProfile so authenticated users can store a human-readable name (per selected authorization component requirements). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement an admin-only guard that requires Internet Identity authentication and checks isCallerAdmin/getCallerUserRole before rendering admin content; show an access denied state otherwise. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the admin inquiries view with a basic list and a detail panel/view; fetch list via getAllContactInquiries and fetch details via getContactInquiry. If using shadcn-ui Table/Dialog/Card components, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add React Query hooks for admin inquiry list/detail queries that depend on the actor from useActor and handle authorization failures gracefully (do not crash the UI).

Include an Admin entry point (e.g., a button/link) that is only shown when the caller is authenticated and is an admin, and include the LoginButton in the header. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire an admin route/view (e.g., via hash routing or an in-app view switch) that renders AdminInquiriesPage behind AdminRouteGuard; ensure non-admins cannot access inquiry listings in the UI.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent, professional, high-trust theme (not predominantly blue/purple) across the site.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across headings, body text, buttons, cards, and navigation
Primary palette is not predominantly blue/purple
Design feels professional, high-trust, and accessible (sufficient contrast for text and controls)

file_operations.description: Create global styles and Tailwind base layers, including CSS variables for a cohesive palette (e.g., charcoal + deep green + sand/stone accents) that avoids blue/purple dominance; apply consistent typography and spacing defaults.
Adjust/extend theme tokens as needed to support the chosen palette/typography/spacing consistently (while continuing to use the existing CSS variable-driven color system).
Ensure layout-level styling (header/footer/background/typography scale) consistently applies the theme across all sections and the admin view.

Align form controls, validation messaging, and button styling to the global theme; ensure accessible contrast and focus states. If using shadcn-ui components, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add generated static image assets (logo + hero visual) and render them in the header and hero section.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are included as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated
Logo is used in the site header/navigation
Hero visual is used in the Home hero section and scales responsively

file_operations.description: Add the generated logo asset as a static file at the specified path so the frontend can render it in the site header/navigation.
Add the generated hero illustration asset as a static file at the specified path so the frontend can render it in the Home hero section responsively.
Render the logo image from frontend/public/assets/generated/it-consulting-logo.dim_512x512.png in the header/navigation with appropriate sizing for responsive breakpoints.
Render the hero visual from frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-datacenter.dim_1600x900.png in the hero section and ensure it scales/crops responsively without harming readability.
